title: Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe's daughter, 5, arrives back in UK after 3 years in Iran
text:

The five-year-old daughter of a British-Iranian woman jailed in Tehran has finally arrived back in the UK.

Gabriella Zaghari-Ratcliffe spent the last three and a half years living in Iran with her grandparents.

But now it is thought she can start primary school in the UK and spent Christmas here.

"Gabriella came back to us late at night, a bit uncertain seeing those she only remembered from the phone," her dad Richard Ratcliffe said.

"Now she is peacefully sleeping next to me. And I am just watching."

He told Sky News: "It has been a long journey to have her home, with bumps right until the end - and I am grateful to all those at the British Embassy and Iranian MFA who helped smooth all those last blockages."

(Image: PA)

(Image: PA)

The youngster has only been allowed to see mum Nazanin in the notorious Evin Prison when the Iranian authorities would allow.

Mrs Zaghari-Ratcliffe was sentenced to five years in jail after being accused of spying, which she vehemently denies.

Since then, husband Richard has been campaigning for the mum to be freed.

(Image: The Free Nazanin campaign)

In a letter smuggled out of jail recently, Mrs Zaghari-Ratcliffe wrote: "I have no hope or motivation after my baby goes.

"There is no measure to my pain. In the near future, my baby will leave me to go to her father and start school in the UK.

"It will be a daunting trip for her travelling and me left behind."
description: Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe remains jailed in a notorious prison in Iran as husband Richard Ratcliffe campaigns for her return too
